content: Trying to use #[deprecated] on a trait implementation results in the deny-by-default useless_deprecated lint. Is it theoretically possible to support deprecating a trait impl, and give a compiler warning every time code uses that impl?
I just ran into a case where that would be really useful, because the next best alternative is a runtime panic when the impl is used.

I would guess that this is difficult for the same reason that we don't have stability checking for impls.

So it would probably depend on how important it would be for it to be caught reliably in all cases.
i looked into it a bit when i updated the useless_deprecated lint to include that case, but at that time it looked too complicated to me to actually make the attribute work.
This is mostly the same problem as detecting unused impls
I have to figure out a way to work around the caching issues that WF checking causes
